DISCOVERY.description: Focuses on discovery exercises including research, workshops and user analyses among others.

milestones.summary: Works effectively in Discovery support of the Product team by following best practices and direction from senior team members
signals: Takes direction from senior team members but challenges the status quo
Organizes and handles logistics related to discovery efforts (e.g., writing a screener, recruiting participants, preparing tech/room)
Has a basic understanding of discovery efforts and how to conduct them, but may not know which tools to use for which scenario
examples: Conducts basic competitive analysis and research
Can ask intelligent follow up questions during discovery conversations
Takes notes in workshops/ meetings/ user interviews
Conducts SWOT Analysis

milestones.summary: Facilitates individual Discovery efforts or other research independently
signals: Has a basic understanding of which tool or framework to use to achieve the right results
Looks for information in the right places
Synthesizes notes and feedback (user interviews, competitors, heuristic analysis) to draw conclusions
examples: Leads/conducts user interviews and ensures they are comprehensive
Creates a conversation guide and approach to the conversation process
Puts together and executes a Discovery Plan
Synthesizes learnings into a comprehensive summary

milestones.summary: Effectively facilitates broader Discovery efforts that are less defined and riskier to achieve
signals: Consistently turns data and information into actionable insights and recommendations
Can be an ambassador for different approaches and can apply them
Shows a passion for analysis and fact-finding that drives a search for truth
Consistenly connects dots across different discovery efforts to further the project, mission, and goal
examples: Can improvise through user interviews
Can facilitate a medium to large size group through an exercise (workshops, focus groups, etc)
Determines how results of discovery efforts contribute to the overall findings and learnings

milestones.summary: Consistently uncovers original insights that materially inform strategies
signals: Teaches different methods to clients and associates based on the problem presented and industry considerations
Applies industry expertise and learnings to different clients
Consistently adapts frameworks to meet the needs of the problem
examples: Guides multiple streams of discovery across a project or client
Recognizes the advantages and disadvantages of different approaches, tools, and frameworks and guides clients and teams on best practices within each
Acts as a SME or expert on projects to guide efforts

milestones.summary: Is an industry-leading expert in Discovery or has developed original Discovery methods that move the discipline forward
signals: Leads the industry through thought leadership in discovery
Receives regular invitations to be a keynote speaker / SME
Sought after by major corporations for engagements
examples: Authors new approaches and ways of conducting discovery
Uses expertise to define best practices for specific applications across clients and industries
Provides thought leadership for the industry

STRATEGY.description: Focuses on generating insights based on the business, users, landscape and environment.

milestones.summary: Works effectively within established structures, following current best practices
signals: Defines success through quantitative methods
Demonstrates awareness of the risks as well as benefits to a solution
Supports other strategists in developing client strategy
examples: Completed a competitive analysis
Validated a hypothesis through data
Contributed to larger analysis efforts for a client (e.g., business model canvas, service blueprint, etc.)

milestones.summary: Derives relationships among findings that shape significant direction for an engagement
signals: Draws actionable insights from analyses created
Understands the design and technical implications of a strategic recommendation
Contributes equitably or independently to the development of client strategy
examples: Used competitive analysis to identify novel opportunities in the market
Leveraged user testing or usability results to synthesize actionable insights
Routinely established alignment with client during an engagement.

milestones.summary: Discovers breakthroughs in a client's strategic approach that appreciably moves a business unit forward in unique and measurable ways
signals: Offers key perspectives and insights that guide a client's strategic direction
Utilizes knowledge and experience for offering and capability development
Leads other strategists or team members in pursuit of a client's strategy
Adapts approach, tools, and frameworks used to the changing needs of a client and project
examples: Built a robust product roadmap
Deployed strategy that resulted in meaningful impact for a business unit within a corporation
Synthesized strategic concepts that inspired new work with an existing client

milestones.summary: Drives breakthroughs that appreciably moves the entire organization forward in unique and measurable ways
signals: Leads, recruits around, and serves clients with a core strategic offering
Routinely sought for mentorship around a specific area of expertise or general strategy
Leads multiple teams of strategists and other disciplines in pursuit of a larger client's strategy
examples: Deployed strategy that resulted in meaningful impact for an entire corporation
Led a workshop or training session to educate peers on a new skill, framework, approach, etc
Synthesized strategic concepts that won work with an entirely new major client

milestones.summary: Is an industry-leading expert in strategy or sets strategic direction for entire industries
signals: Leads the industry through thought leadership in client strategy
Receives regular invitations to be a keynote speaker / SME
Sought after by major corporations for engagements
examples: Wrote a book that is widely adopted by the industry
Developed an original strategic methodology that is widely used
Publicly recognized on a flight or in the street

PRESENCE.description: Focuses on establishing relationships both internally and externally through rapport, presentation excellence and actively driving project success.

milestones.summary: Works effectively in a professional environment by supporting senior team members and contributes in client interactions
signals: Asks intelligent questions and makes valuable observations
Helps to remove obstacles
Understands the needs of stakeholders
examples: Effectively delivers status of tasks to the client
Clearly socializes project needs
Asks helpful questions in client meetings, and leads some client meetings

milestones.summary: Quickly creates rapport with a client and instills confidence with internal teams
signals: Understands teams' capabilities and strengths
Anticipates obstacles
Anticipates future needs of stakeholders
examples: Client demonstrates trust over time
Identifies/raises concerns of risks
Suggests Other Problems to Solve
Comfortably leads client meetings regularly

milestones.summary: Directs client and team interactions and conveys information in an engaging manner
signals: Establishes client trust early on
Involved in client/prospect roadmapping sessions and ties together various pieces outside of project
Reliable and autonomous on projects
examples: Develops Executive Materials for Large Projects
Anticipates and mitigates risk
Delivers Large Executive Presentations
Able to control a challenging conversation and react to curve balls

milestones.summary: Establishes enriching relationships such that they are requested to lead engagements.
signals: SME used in Business Development/Sales efforts
Relationships from projects lead to business dev opportunities
Advising and enabling clients & Skookumites on best practices and industry perspective
examples: Client requests you to lead a strategic team
Proposes and presents follow on work enabled by current projects to senior client stakeholders for buy-in and sales opportunities
Adds unique takes on current offerings/defines new offerings

milestones.summary: Well regarded expert across multiple industries that could create their own consultancy
signals: Personal Brand (social media presence, conference talks, TEDtalks, speaker series) is publically recognized
Growth Opportunities arise from personal brand
Perspective is valued in industry
examples: Delivers unique presentation at multiple speaking engagements
Developed a new methodology for business development
Content generated attracts large, EM level clients

PRODUCTION.description: Ability to product manage and partner with developers from engineering through deployment and run an agile method

milestones.summary: Works effectively within established structures, following current best practices
signals: Updates acceptance criteria for stories based on developer feedback
Understands basic web design principles
examples: Conducts sprint retros
Understands and follows a technical design and architecture

milestones.summary: Executes against a production methodology to deliver products
signals: Writes epics and user stories for a small application
Leads team through development of a website, iOS or Android app, or small product
Is a practicioner of Agile methodologies and contributing member of the team
Is aware of cloud platforms and services that contribute to the modern web
examples: Runs story grooming sessions
Understands the purpose of APIs and how they contribute to technical design and modern web applications
Conducts End of Sprint demos for business unit
Understands frontend, backend and responsive web methodologies

milestones.summary: Delivers quality products of moderate complexity
signals: Effectively defines and delivers against a product roadmap
Certified Scrum Product Owner or other certification
examples: Guides a large team through end-to-end Agile development
Writes blog posts about product management topics

milestones.summary: Delivers complex, large scale products or creates best practices that enrich the entire production team
signals: Delivers user story creation feedback and coaches team members in story writing best practices
Builds thought leadership on production best practices and mentors others
"Consults" on multiple production engagements across Skookum
examples: Distills and explains retro findings to business to influence future offerings and processes
Is a "go-to person" for best practices and tangible examples of real-world scenarios
Contributes product management knowledge to sales proposals and marketing materials

milestones.summary: Is an industry-leading expert in product management or has created new and unique methods for delivering software in an Agile environment
signals: Leads the industry through thought leadership in client production
Receives regular invitations to be a keynote speaker / SME
Sought after by corporations for engagements
examples: Writes a book that is widely adopted by the industry
Develops an original production methodology that is widely used in the market

PROJECT MANAGEMENT.description: Delivers well-scoped programs of work that meet their goals, on time, to budget, harmoniously

milestones.summary: Effectively delivers individual tasks
signals: Estimates small tasks accurately
Delivers tightly-scoped projects efficiently
Actively participates in standups
examples: Split a large task into small tasks that can be completed to meet the requirements
Completed sprint work that they committed to finish
Recorded actuals on stories to help calibrate estimates

milestones.summary: Effectively delivers small projects
signals: Performs research and considers alternative approaches
Does not sacrifice the important for the sake of the urgent
Defines and hits interim milestones
examples: Re-estimated the backlog to update team on remaining work
Timeboxed research into alternative approach to make sure important tasks were still completed
Updated team on progress of large story and completed when estimated

milestones.summary: Leads the delivery of small projects
signals: Delegates tasks to others appropriately
Integrates client needs into project planning
Chooses appropriate project management strategy based on context
examples: Ran sprint retro to assess improvement opportunities
Completed launch checklist unprompted for well controlled rollout
Facilitated project kickoff meeting to get buy-in

milestones.summary: Effectively delivers projects through a large team, or with a significant amount of stakeholders or complexity
signals: Finds ways to deliver requested scope faster, and prioritizes backlog
Manages dependencies on other projects and teams
Leverages recognition of repeated project patterns
examples: Improves project visibility by publishing metrics in a central location.
Identified dependency on client team for work coming up in the next sprint
Analyzed the velocity of the team to identify trends

milestones.summary: Manages major company pushes delivered by multiple teams
signals: Considers external constraints and business objectives when planning
Leads teams of teams, and coordinates effective cross- functional collaboration
Owns a key company metric
examples: Created Sprint checklists for new project managers and train them on how to use the checklist
Oversaw multiple project teams and negotiated the resourcing needed to staff all of them
Held project teams accountable to delivering on time

COMMUNICATION.description: Shares the right amount of information with the right people, at the right time, and listens effectively

milestones.summary: Communicates effectively to stakeholders and teammates when called upon
signals: Contributes to crafting of project status & deliverable messaging
Collaborates well with both project team and clients
Asks for help at the appropriate juncture
examples: Drafts Status and deliverables independently, with the right language and content
Engages teammates in activity to work toward project objective
Communicates blindspots and risks to Lead and Peers to gather feedback / insight

milestones.summary: Communicates with the wider client and project team effectively. Is able to form a message that focuses on timeliness, content, and conciseness
signals: Practices active listening and suspension of attention
Communicates project status and risks to cleint clearly
Chooses the appropriate tools/method for accurate and timely communication
examples: Received and integrated critical feedback positively
Presents status to project leadership and receives valuable feedback
Pivots status delivery method to accomodate for lack of project visability to key stakeholders

milestones.summary: Is a strong storyteller that proactively shares information, actively solicits feedback, and facilitates communication for multiple stakeholders.
signals: Mediates communication difficulties between others
Anticipates key project communications to prevent surprises
Identifies new communication channels within the client/project stakeholder group
examples: Works closely with teammates to workout requirement details that were lost in translation
Identifies need for and crafts communication to project stakeholders
Identifies stakeholders that aren't being properly included and identifies an avenue for bringing them into the conversation

milestones.summary: Communicates complex ideas skillfully and with nuance, and establishes alignment within the wider organization
signals: Communicates project risk and tradeoffs skillfully and with nuance
Contextualizes and clarifies ambiguous direction and strategy for others
Negotiates resourcing compromises with other teams
examples: Lead training for other Skookum employees on giving presentations
Wrote new hiring process documentation for Functional Team
Aligned the entire organization around new process

milestones.summary: Influences outcomes at the highest level, moves beyond mere broadcasting, and sets best practices for others
signals: Defines processes for clear communication for the entire company
Shares the right amount of information with the right people, at the right time
Develops and delivers plans to leadership team
examples: Shared vision for where the company is heading to create buy-in with everyone.
Created the communication plan for a large organizational change
Presented to the company about key company metrics and projects

CRAFT QUALITY.description: Embodies and promotes practices to ensure excellent quality products and services

milestones.summary: Delivers consistently good quality work
signals: Seeks feedback on deliverables to help ensure high quality for everything a client sees
Minimizes rework on items delivered to teammates
Writes clear comments and documentation of the work we do
examples: Caught a bug on a project before it went live
Ran hallway user testing of prototype to get quick feedback on ideas
Wrote unit tests for new feature

milestones.summary: Increases the robustness and reliability of our deliverables, and devotes time to polishing products and systems
signals: Leaves things better than you found it
Schedules time to get consistent feedback on progress of deliverables
Reviews our process and removes items that become irrelevant on a project
examples: Helped teammate work through tough issue
Documented a found bug with clear reproduction steps
Proactively resolved a known issue before being tasked with it

milestones.summary: Improves others' ability to deliver great quality work
signals: Implements systems that enable better testing
Gives thoughtful reviews and critiques as a domain expert
Adds tooling to improve quality of deliverables
examples: Setup new plugin on Jenkins to run snapshot UI tests
Wrote project setup script to simplify project onboarding to help migitate missing steps
Organized teams to get more people involved in code reviews or ad hoc testing

milestones.summary: Advocates for and models great quality with proactive actions, and tackles difficult and subtle system issues
signals: Builds systems so as to eliminate entire classes of programmer error
Focuses the team on quality with regular reminders
Pragmatically identifies areas where more effort should be put to ensure quality
examples: Added code coverage reporting to communicate risk to client
Worked with Sales team to improve messaging around the value of quality to clients
Defined and oversaw plan for closing Heartbleed vulnerability on all client projects

milestones.summary: Enables and encourages the entire organization to make quality a central part of our processes
signals: Defines policies for the Services Org that encourage quality work
Identifies and eliminates single points of failure throughout the organization
Secures time and resources from execs to support great quality
examples: Negotiated resources for Fix-It week with client
Instituted and ensured success of a 20% time policy
Created cross project quality reporting tool to expose entire org to project quality

INSTITUTIONAL KNOWLEDGE.description: Seeks to improve Skookum through making local learnings have a larger impact across Skookum.

milestones.summary: Understands processes to gain efficiency and learn from others' knowledge
signals: Checks to see if there are already processes to learn from
Seeks help and critique
Embraces change as a necessity for growth
examples: Asked a question about a documented process in Confluence
Asked a question at company lunch
Followed project kick-off checklist

milestones.summary: Informally shares new knowledge with others
signals: Makes connections between projects and experience to identify trends
Experiments early and often
Instigates major new features, services, or architectures
examples: Presented the results of a project retrospective at a company lunch
Wrote article in Confluence about a new tool to use on projects
Provided feedback on how to improve review process

milestones.summary: Creates processes to formalize knowledge, documenting why the process was created or changed
signals: Demonstrates concepts proactively with prototypes
Runs experiments on process improvements
Knows how to connect changes to creating value for Skookum
examples: Updated process documentation to match actuals and wrote up explanation of why the previous process changed
Created process to integrate project restrospectives to find commonalities
Organized lunch video series to engage team in learning

milestones.summary: Creates new ways to share knowledge across the organization
signals: Champions and pioneers new technologies to solve new classes of problem
Follows through with ensuring buy-in on new processes
Identifies holes in institutional knowledge and seeks to remedy
examples: Setup and drive the migration to Confluence as the knowledgebase for Skookum
Defined process for experimentation on projects and report findings to the entire company
Created an interviewing rubric and booklet

milestones.summary: Defines processes that change the way that Skookum does business
signals: Drives cross-departmental knowledge sharing
Galvanizes the entire company and garners buy in for a new strategy
Changes complex organizational processes
examples: Created a new model to follow instead of agile/scrum that produces better measurable results
Defined a new process to re-organize the company around specialtizations
Drove process to map all department processes on to company values to clarify processes

CAREER DEVELOPMENT.description: Provides strategic support to others to help them build the career they want

milestones.summary: Gives insight into opportunities and helps identify individuals' strengths and weaknesses
signals: Advocates on behalf and in defense of a group member
Shares opportunities for improvements and recognises achievements
Explains appropriate available industry paths
examples: Collected and delivered feedback
Discussed career options and areas of interest informally
Reviewed Growth Framework to help identify areas to focus on

milestones.summary: Formally supports and advocates for one person and provides tools to help them solve career problems
signals: Listens with the intent to understand, not the intent to respond
Offers effective career advice to group members, without being prescriptive
Creates space for people to talk through challenges
examples: Set up and attended regular, constructive 1:1s
Provided coaching on how to have difficult conversations
Advocated for team member to get on project that gives them new opportunities

milestones.summary: Inspires and retains a small group of people and actively pushes them to stretch themselves
signals: Discusses paths, and creates plans for personal and professional growth
Sees value in seeing others succeed
Works with team leads to elevate emerging leaders
examples: Reviewed individual group member progression every 6 weeks
Suggested appropriate group member for Senior position
Helped team member set actionable quarterly goals

milestones.summary: Manages interactions and processes between groups, promoting best practices and setting a positive example
signals: Manages team transitions smoothly, respecting team and individual needs
Develops best practices for conflict resolution
Ensures all group members' roles are meeting their career needs
examples: Completed training on situational leadership
Coached a teammate through tough situation with client
Prevented regretted attrition with intentional, targeted intervention

milestones.summary: Supports the development of a signficant part of the services org, and widely viewed as a trusted advisor
signals: Supports and develops senior leaders
Identified leadership training opportunities for senior leadership
Pushes everyone to be as good as they can be, with empathy
examples: Provided coaching to group leads
Developed senior team member into a people manager
Advocated to execs for training resources and programs

RECRUITING.description: Strengthens Skookum's team by bringing in excellent staff members

milestones.summary: Brings new candidates into the pipeline and understands how to evaluate candidates at Skookum
signals: Reviews existing network for hiring leads regularly
Shadows interviews to gain familiarity with process
Reviews current job postings regularly
examples: Completed interview calibration
Set up casual sessions to practice asking questions
Referred appropriate individuals for open positions

milestones.summary: Interviews regularly, helps the team make meaningful hiring decisions, and helps build a diverse pipeline
signals: Uses interview rubric to provide clear, objective feedback on candidates
Interviews candidates with empathy and treats them all with equal respect
Researches approaches for sourcing candidates and diversifying hiring
examples: Added observable evidence for every rating
Started an event for candidates to meet Skookum employees
Tested a new service for quality and diversity of candidates

milestones.summary: Maintains and strengthens the integrity of the current process, and regularly brings in great candidates
signals: Teaches new interviewers how to interview with empathy
Models great interview technique and feedback when shadowed
Reverse shadows trainees and helps calibrate their feedback
examples: Wrote new interview question which meets our question quality criteria
Brought candidates into our pipeline proactively, with a high conversion rate
Proposed useful, tangible improvements to the interview process

milestones.summary: Actively contributes to and leads hiring decisions, and goes to great lengths to source great candidates
signals: Documents subtle cues in interviews that indicate values alignment
Makes hiring decisions, resolving discrepancies between conflicting reports
Identifies great fits for Skookum and leads them through the hiring process
examples: Planned team meeting on interview process and training
Organized and lead Skookum's presence at a recruitment fair
Maintained relationship with local code schools to build our reputation among graduates

milestones.summary: Sets recruitment strategy, invests in long-term relationships for critical roles, and recruits at scale
signals: Sets the tone, policy and goals around building a diverse, high-quality team
Leads efforts to increase diversity at Skookum
Tracks industry activity, identifying opportunities for critical roles
examples: Talked with a senior candidate over many months to fill a critical role
Helped quickly fill multiple positions that were open with quality candidates
Set goals, then tracked and reported metrics on team demographics over time

MENTORSHIP.description: Provides support to colleagues, spreads knowledge, and develops the team outside formal reporting structures

milestones.summary: Informally mentors individuals in an ad-hoc way, supports new hires, and conveys institutional knowledge
signals: Makes themself available for informal support and advice
Acts as sounding board for peers and more junior members
Provides sound advice when asked
examples: Acted as an onboarding buddy
Paired with a teammate to help them with an unfamiliar area
Helped a colleague understand their feelings

milestones.summary: Mentors people proactively, and guides people to realizations rather than providing the answer
signals: Takes time to explain concepts and best practices
Asks questions to illuminate concepts, rather than stating them
Allows others to lead efforts when it will help their development
examples: Shared interesting article with a team member to help with their growth
Offered unprompted feedback to help growth, with empathy
Lead from behind to support someone new to a leadership role

milestones.summary: Teaches small groups of teammates and contributes to Skookum's shared knowledge base
signals: Avoids siloing information when it can be usefully shared with others
Drives healthy discussion around new ideas
Finds tools that work best for a team member's personality
examples: Gave a brown bag presentation on a technology
Engaged audience in presentation at company lunch
Ran book club on relevant book

milestones.summary: Encourages people to mentor each other, and creates ways for them to do so
signals: Defines an entire curriculum for a discipline
Draws positive attention to well-modeled mentor and teaching behaviours
Actively looks for team members that need help and partners with them for growth
examples: Created and lead Skookum's Women in Eng group
Brought in an outside speaker to a team or company meeting
Connected junior team member with senior team member that was looking for leadership opportunity

milestones.summary: Instills and promotes a culture of learning and development within the entire team
signals: Sets incentive structures to recognise and reward mentorship
Empowers team members to develop themselves
Role models productive and healthy mentor relationships
examples: Instituted the professional education budget for everyone
Mentored mentors
Started the advisor program and lined up external mentors

SALES AND MARKETING SUPPORT.description: Helps the sales and marketing teams sell our services in order to increase the number of people that we can help

milestones.summary: Helps create opportunities for our sales team to start conversations
signals: Refer clients to our sales team
Create content for the marketing team through existing channels
Assist in marketing needs
examples: Identify an acquaintance that needs one of Skookum's services
Write a new blog post about a relevant technology topic
Fix a bug on Skookum.com

milestones.summary: Consults with the Sales Team to help scope and estimate a client project
signals: Empathizes with clients to identify their problem
Estimates the size of projects analytically
Identifies other opportunities with a client to work with Skookum
examples: Joined sales team on sales calls/meetings
Filled out the estimation template to document sales estimations
Helped the sales team sell a support contract

milestones.summary: Looks for opportunities to create efficiencies in the sales and marketing of Skookum's services
signals: Creates tools to increase quality of estimates
Helps marketing gather more data about potential clients
Author significant portion of a proposal
examples: Improved the estimation template
Ran statistical analysis of old estimates vs actuals
Worked with Marketing to add new analytics framework to website

milestones.summary: Opens new ways for potential clients to interact with Skookum
signals: Creates new marketing channels
Generates new sales from current clients
Sells the value of Skookum as a partner
examples: Started a Skookum podcast and reached a significant audience
Built demo space to showcase Skookum projects
Organized tech conference that attracts technical leaders

milestones.summary: Identifies new lines of business and helps the sales team sell them
signals: Creates new service area for Skookum to sell
examples: Built BlockChain prototype and worked with Sales to find a buyer

CUSTOMER VALUE.description: Creates more value for our customers in order to increase retention and provide a world class experience. We focus on value not cost

milestones.summary: Empathizes with customers and the problems that they come to us for help with
signals: Engages with clients during meetings (and before and after)
Actively listens to client problem desciption and ask thoughtful follow-up questions
Understands the constraints of a project
examples: Researched news about a client company before a meeting with them
Intentionally gave the client the better seat at a meeting or meal
Came prepared to client meeting with calrifying questions

milestones.summary: Identifies areas where their project team can provide more value to the customer
signals: Builds trust with the client through execution
Asks clients probing questions
Empathizes with client's problems
examples: Solicited feedback from a client to make sure that we are aligned
Researched competitors and presented it to the client for feedback
Shared industry information with project team and how it applies to the work we're doing

milestones.summary: Creates more value for customers on projects
signals: Executes on ideas to create more value for the client
Presents Skookum's value effectively
Does not sacrifice contractual work in order to create more value
examples: Delivered small tweaks to delight users
Rehearsed client presentation and made changes based on feedback
Created media assets showing the process to demonstrate value to the client

milestones.summary: Leads efforts on project to maximize customer value on projects
signals: Identifies areas for others to create more value for the client
Encourages others to look for ways to create more value for the client
examples: Coordinated brainstorming session on creative ways to solve client's problems
Developed lasting relationship with a client that lead to a referral of another client

milestones.summary: Effects change that increases cuctomer retention across the entire company
signals: Creates value with every interaction with a client
Challenges clients to think differently about their business
Models investing in our client's businesses within our engagements

COMMUNITY.description: Builds community internally and/or externally, gives of themself to the team, and champions and extols company values

milestones.summary: Represents Skookum well, and influences individuals positively
signals: Participates in team activities and offsites
Treats colleagues and clients with respect
Attends Skookum-hosted events and talks with guests
examples: Joined and actively participated in a local meetup
Planned an informal group activity for co-workers
Shared a Skookum event post on social media

milestones.summary: Participates more centrally in small events, and takes simple actions that positively influence groups of people
signals: Makes space for others to participate
Collaborates with others outside direct responsibilities
Takes meaningful action to introduce people to Skookum
examples: Volunteered with local school to talk about jobs in tech
Presented at a local Meetup
Routinely participates in on-boarding training

milestones.summary: Works hard to positively influence large groups of people on their views of Skookum
signals: Mentors or participates in a high visibility way in an external organization
Builds fruitful partnerships with external organizations
Writes blog posts about Skookum that receive moderate traffic
examples: Represented Skookum on a panel at a conference of industry experts
Ran a Meetup that introduced qualified candidates to Skookum
Built a durable, long-standing org relationship with non-profit

milestones.summary: Establishes Skookum as an great, innovative company and workplace to the whole industry
signals: Establishes themself as an industry thought leader who attracts talent
Implements concrete programs to signficantly improve team inclusivity
Creates community around Skookum to grow community awareness of us as a company and employer
examples: Devoted large amount of time to helping outside direct responsibilities
Published a paper on Skookum technology in a peer-reviewed journal
Active maintainer of Skookum open source project for a prolonged period of time

milestones.summary: Lives the company values, guards positive culture, and defines policies that support relatedness between teams
signals: Influences people with large audiences to talk about Skookum positively
Holds individuals, teams, and leadership accountable to Skookum's values
Sets the tone, policy, and goals around maintaining an inclusive company
examples: Organized offsite for the whole company
Published or interviewed in a mainstream newspaper or website outside tech
Challenged and corrected exclusionary behaviour or policies
